Learn how to set up Asp.net core and AngularJS project with Visual Studio Code

 

In this post, we will look at how you can get started with Asp.Net Core and AngularJS, build an amaizng site with Visual Studio Code

 

Setting Up Environment

npm install -g @angular/cli

 

Creating a new project

ng new my-angular-app

cd my-angular-app

ng serve

 

Setting Up VS CODE for Angular Development

Open a project in Visual Studio Code

Install several extensions that you might need for the project

  - Angular Snippets

  - Angular Files

  - Angular Language Service

  - Angular2 - Switcher

Testing the first app

dotnet build

dotnet run

 

Add Nuget Package Manager

This is to use DbContext

Open a command line in VS CODE

=> Command + Shift + p

=> Nuget Package Manager: Add Package

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design

 

Install DotNet Entity Framework Tools

dotnet tool install --global dotnet-ef

To see commands

dotnet ef -h

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57066856/dotnet-ef-not-found-in-net-core-3

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41536603/visual-studio-code-entity-framework-core-add-migration-not-recognized

dotnet ef migrations add first

dotnet ef database update

 

Running MySql for the Asp.Net Core

Install a package

https://github.com/PomeloFoundation/Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools.DotNet
